committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on International Finance, Trade and Monetary Policy

official_title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the Export-Import Bank of the United States of America should continue to provide preliminary and advanced commitment for loans which may require approval on or after October 1, 1985, in keeping with the Bank's mandate, unless and until the Congress of the United States changes that policy or directs the Bank to alter its programs.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that the Export-Import Bank should continue to provide preliminary and advanced commitment for loans which may require approval on or after October 1, 1985, unless and until the Congress changes the Export-Import Bank's policy or directs the Export-Import Bank to alter its programs.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the Export-Import Bank of the United States of America should continue to provide preliminary and advanced commitment for loans which may require approval on or after October 1, 1985, in keeping with the Bank's mandate, unless and until the Congress of the United States changes that policy or directs the Bank to alter its programs.
